title: Laser turrets and Skirmishers blade reduce true damage, this can't be intended
body:
Just went into a customs with a friend, I played Olaf and he played Xin Zhao.

When I E'd him, he took 102 damage, when I was taking laser agro and E'd him, he took 86 damage.

When he had red smite, I E'd he took 102 damage, after I was smited, he took 81 damage.

Why hell do these 2 things reduce true damage, how is this intended at all.

No wonder I feel like I do less true damage to people as Darius and Olaf, this shit right here.

It's lacking {{summoner:13}}.  And not only does Fiora work differently and can be hit by some target abilities and Autoattacks, Master Yi's untargetable works differently as well.  And I don't even have to get into the inconstancy with things like Ezreal's Arcane Shift and dashes/blinks/things like that.

One can't expect their own defined consistancy in this game, because it won't follow those rules.

Edit: _Before_ you start going on about "Stasis" effects, you **should** remember that word  isn't used by the items or the champions.

For clarity: Zhonyas, Lissandra, and reviving are STASIS effects, not untargetability. They're not the same because they aren't the same thing.

Stasis: Can't take actions or be affected by actions

Untargetability: Can't be hit by spells or autos, can't be targeted, still vulnerable to damage over time and such

>Frozen Tomb: she encases herself in dark ice, becoming untargetable and invulnerable. -client
>On Self Cast: Lissandra encases herself in dark ice for 2.5 seconds, becoming untargetable and invulnerable but unable to take any actions. -leagueoflegends.com/

You might notice that both in the client and on the official website, the word "Stasis" or "Stasis Effect" **do not appear**.  It is described as Untargetable by the game!
You can say "Uhm, actually... They are what we call 'stasis'.  They, uh, actually work differently..."

That's the damn point!
They _don't _ work the same way; that's what I have been writing here!  Nor does the game write or give any indication of that for Aatrox or Guardian Angel.  And I don't even have to get into things like how  Fizz's untargetable damaging dash move operates differently than Yi's untargetable damaging dash move.

All quotes are taken for the League of Legends wiki.

> Upon taking fatal damage, Aatrox enters a **stasis **and begins draining his Blood Well, healing himself over the next 3 seconds. The amount of health restored is equal to 35% of the Blood Well's content limit, plus its amount of stored health upon activation

> Guardian Angel: Revives your champion upon death, restoring 30% of your maximum health and mana after 4 seconds of **stasis**. 5 minute cooldown.

> Zilean places a protective time rune on an allied champion for 5 seconds.  If the target takes lethal damage during that time, they will be placed in Stasis icon stasis for 2 seconds, becoming untargetable and invulnerable but also unable to perform any action. When they come out of **stasis **, they are revived with a set amount of health.

Note that Aatrox passive specifically says he enters stasis and Lissandra's ultimate specifically says she is invulnerable.  

> Fiora dashes around the battlefield — becoming **untargetable **in the process — dealing physical damage to random enemy champion(s) 5 times. Hits against the same target beyond the first deal 40% damage. The first and last attack will be against the same target. Each strike applies on-hit effects.

> Fizz hops onto his trident in a nearby location, becoming **untargetable **for 0.75 seconds and gaining the ability to use Trickster.png Trickster for no additional cost before the effect ends.

>  Maokai transforms into an **untargetable **cloud of arcane energy that quickly travels to a target enemy, deals magic damage (capped at 300 against minions and monsters) and Root icon roots it.

> Vladimir sinks into a 150-radius pool of blood, gaining 37.5% bonus movement speed that decays exponentially for 1 second and becoming **untargetable **for 2 seconds. Note that theese untargetable abilities do not specify stasis or invulnerability.  While you cannot be targeted by abilities or autoattacks, that doesn't mean that you are immune to the effect of abilities (i.e. DoTs) which have already been applied to you.

You are incorrect. The game classifies the effects.

Untargetable effects are described as Untargetable. 
"Statis" effects are described either as Statis or as Untargetable and Invulnerable.

For example:

Aatrox and Guardian Angel are "Statis" (though, in Aatrox case the only place where it's called that is when you are actually dead and your Passive is in your active effects on the left side).
Lissandra R and Zhonya are "Untargetable and Invulnerable".
Fizz E and Yi's Q are "Untargetable".

So there is a pretty clear classification (though, I wouldn't be surprised if "Statis" and "Untargetable and Invulnerable" also had some differences).

First you have to have somewhat of an understanding of the damage equation.

It goes along the lines of something like this:

Damage = (True Damage + [Magic damage x MR reduction x Modifiers] + [Physical damage x Armor reduction x Modifiers]) x Total Damage Modifiers

The turret debuff and red smite debuff are total damage modifiers. The majority of other skills, including exhaust and alistar's ult, are physical and magic damage modifiers (go read the abilities).

There are very few total damage modifiers and those two are the only ones I can think of off the top of my head.

*Mechanically,* yes, it's working like that.

Just like how, *mechanically,* the old Skirmisher's Sabre applied true damage that ignored invulnerability.

We're not worried about the mechanical "why" behind this. We're wondering why from a design standpoint. The *point of true damage* is that it's supposed to be 100% consistent. It doesn't matter if you have something that increases or decreases the damage dealt to the target, it's supposed to remain the same. The only time it should be negated is with invulnerability, untargetability or an HP shield taking the damage instead.

First, they broke that rule with Ahri, but then they reverted it.
Now, they're breaking that rule with Skirmisher's and laser turrets.
